history.content:
If you are taking your last prereq during the summer, then you won't be declared until after the summer is over and you get your grade. So, your major declaration won't be processed until August, at the earliest.

That said, you can still take upper divs without being declared. So waitlisting during Phase II seems reasonable; you just shouldn't waitlist during Phase I.

---------------------------

As mentioned by the first student, you won't be able to declare until end of summer term. But you can and definitely should sign up for upper divs that you are comfortable with taking. I signed up for CS170 (waitlist) without declaring (did not finish pre-req) and ended up getting in and doing well in that class. You just need to be in the midset to put in more work than your upoerclassmen coursemates.

If you are taking your last prereq during the summer, then you won't be declared until after the summer is over and you get your grade. So, your major declaration won't be processed until August, at the earliest.

That said, you can still take upper divs without being declared. So waitlisting during Phase II seems reasonable; you just shouldn't waitlist during Phase I.

I have one more course to take (taking this summer) in order to declare. Would major declarations be processed in time so that I can take an upper div CS course in the fall (is it worth waitlisting during my phase II)?

Thanks!
history.subject: CS Upper Div
